subject: Basketball
Suits and Litigation
Handicapped
lead_paragraph: Roy Tarpley is suing the Dallas Mavericks and the N.B.A., claiming they violated the Americans with Disabilities Act by refusing to reinstate him to the league. Tarpley, who was permanently banned from the N.B.A. in 1995, said in his lawsuit the N.B.A. and the Mavericks discriminated against him as a recovering drug and alcohol abuser. In May, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission sided with Tarpley, ruling the league violated the disabilities act by failing to reinstate Tarpley, 42, who has passed all drug tests he has taken in the last four years.
